main_point: The professor explains Supramolecular hosts and noncovalent binding and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes transition state (a process) from catalyst (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving overpotential and adsorption isotherm.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about an ethics aside to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for photolysis shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
